thread.title: Pedestrian fatally struck on I-70 westbound in Lake St. Louis
thread.title_full: Pedestrian fatally struck on I-70 westbound in Lake St. Louis

author: Nassim Benchaabane St. Louis Post-Dispatch
title: Pedestrian fatally struck on I-70 westbound in Lake St. Louis
text:
9 min ago ( … ) 
LAKE ST. LOUIS • A pedestrian was fatally struck Tuesday night on Interstate 70 in Lake St. Louis. 
The incident happened shortly after 6 p.m. on I-70 west of Bryan Road, police said. 
The victim had been walking across the interstate when he ran into an oncoming vehicle, Missouri Highway Patrol Sgt. Al Nothum said. The vehicle had damage to its front passenger side after the collision. 
The victim was thrown by the initial collision and then was hit by two other vehicles, Nothum said. The victim was pronounced dead at the scene. 
Police did not identify the victim pending notification of family. 
All westbound lanes near Bryan Road were closed to traffic after the incident. Authorities said the lanes would not reopen until at least 9 p.m. 
The Missouri Department of Transportation advised motorists to avoid the area and use an alternate route. 
The Missouri Highway Patrol was at the scene Tuesday night. Investigators had not yet determined how fast the vehicles that struck the victim were travelling or why the victim was on the roadway. 
This is a developing story.
